name: argyle
readme: #argylernA basic SOCKS5 server library written for node.js.rnrn##Features/Limitationsrnargyle supports the most basic features of SOCKS and not a whole lot more, namely:rnrn- 'No authentication' auth mode *only*rn- CONNECT commmand *only*rnrnIn the future I may add support for more auth modes and commands, but currently this implementation works well for my main use case (sitting between a local browser and server).rnrn##Usagern###Example:

proxy serverrn```javascriptrnvar argyle = require('argyle');rnrnvar server = argyle(8080, '127.0.0.1');rnserver.on('connected', function(req, dest) {rntreq.pipe(dest);rntdest.pipe(req);rn});rn```rnrn###Example: Throttled proxy server using node-throttled-streamrn```javascriptrnvar argyle = require('argyle'),rntthrottle = require('./throttled-stream'),rntkbpsUp = 32,rntkbpsDown = 128;rnrnvar server = argyle(8080, '127.0.0.1');rnserver.on('connected', function(req, dest) {rntvar tReq = throttle(req, kbpsUp * 1024),rntttDest = throttle(dest, kbpsDown * 1024);rntrntdest.once('error', function(err) { req.end(); })rntt.on('close', function() { req.end(); });rntrnttReq.on('data', function(chunk) {rnttdest.write(chunk);rnt});rnttDest.on('data', function(chunk) {rnttreq.write(chunk);rnt});rn});rn```rnrn##Methodsrn###argyle([port = 8080], [host = 127.0.0.1], [debug = false])rnSets up a new SOCKS server on the specified port and host. If debug is specified, the server will output messages about the status of connections.rnrn##Eventsrn###'connected'rnA new client connected to the server and the socket to their requested destination is now open. Handlers for this event are passed a `request` socket, corresponding to the client that made the request from the server, and a `destination` socket, corresponding to the server that they requested to connect to.rnrn##InstallationrnWith npm:rnrn```rnnpm install argylern```rnrn##LicensernWTFPLrn
